Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Porous molecular traps with ordered nanopores

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry and specific recognition via Ag-Cl interaction, leading to increased photocurrent.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol, 20 min incubation
Other Information.Additional Info: Able to diffuse rapidly into the HOFs pores and specifically bind to Ag via Ag···Cl interactions, resulting in increased photocurrent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-restricted entry and lack of specific Ag-Cl interaction, leading to low adsorption and no significant signal.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol, 20 min incubation
Other Information.Additional Info: Larger size compared to most passing simulants, adsorbed at lower concentration. No significant signal change in photocurrent relative to background.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry, but absence of Ag-Cl interaction prevents accumulation and significant signal.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol, 20 min incubation
Other Information.Additional Info: Smaller size, chlorine-free. Adsorbed in low concentrations due to lack of Ag···Cl interactions. No significant signal change in photocurrent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry, but absence of Ag-Cl interaction prevents accumulation and significant signal.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol, 20 min incubation
Other Information.Additional Info: Smaller size, chlorine-free. Adsorbed in low concentrations due to lack of Ag···Cl interactions. No significant signal change in photocurrent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, blocked by pore channels.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol
Other Information.Additional Info: Anticipated to be excluded from pore channels due to larger molecular size. No significant signal change.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry, but absence of Ag-Cl interaction prevents accumulation and significant signal.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol, 20 min incubation
Other Information.Additional Info: Smaller size, chlorine-free. Adsorbed in low concentrations due to lack of Ag···Cl interactions. No significant signal change in photocurrent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry, but absence of Ag-Cl interaction prevents accumulation and significant signal.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol, 20 min incubation
Other Information.Additional Info: Smaller size, chlorine-free. Adsorbed in low concentrations due to lack of Ag···Cl interactions. No significant signal change in photocurrent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, blocked by pore channels despite containing chloride.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol
Other Information.Additional Info: Anticipated to be excluded from pore channels due to larger molecular size. No significant signal change.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, blocked by pore channels despite containing chloride.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol
Other Information.Additional Info: Anticipated to be excluded from pore channels due to larger molecular size. No significant signal change.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, blocked by pore channels.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol, 20 min incubation
Other Information.Additional Info: Larger molecular size, adsorbed at lower concentrations. No significant signal change in photocurrent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry, but not an electron donor and no specific Ag-Cl interaction, leading to decreased photocurrent.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol
Other Information.Additional Info: Smaller molecular dimension, able to enter pores. Text states it 'only contain chloride groups and no sulfides' (original text chemical description used).

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry, contains chloride but not an electron donor, leading to decreased photocurrent.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol
Other Information.Additional Info: Able to diffuse rapidly into the HOFs pores. Contains chloride groups but no sulfides. Strong decrease in photocurrent.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-permitted entry, contains chloride but not an electron donor, leading to decreased photocurrent.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, 100 nmol mL-1 in methanol
Other Information.Additional Info: Able to diffuse rapidly into the HOFs pores. Contains chloride groups but no sulfides. Strong decrease in photocurrent.

Sieving Mechanism: Synergistic molecular sieving based on pore aperture size-exclusion and site-specific recognition via Ag-Cl interactions.

Experimental Validation.Method: Photoelectrochemical (PEC) sensing via photocurrent response measurements; Adsorption concentration determination by NMR spectroscopy; Chemical bonding environment analysis by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Selective recognition of CEES among 13 different mustard gas simulants. Detection limit for CEES: 15.8 nmol L-1 (S/N = 3). Linear range for CEES: 20-400 nmol L-1. Reusability: at least 30 cycles. Long-term working stability: at least 30 days (5.7% decrease in photocurrent).

Other Information.Additional Info: Composed of ultrafine sub-1 nm (average diameter ~1 nm) silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) homogeneously encapsulated within a hydrogen-bonded organic framework (HOF-101). AgNPs enhance conductivity and produce surface plasmon resonance effect, accelerating photogenerated carrier separation. Designed as a portable PEC device for CWAs detection.
